intro: Alstroemeria haemantha var. pilosa, commonly known as the hairy alstroemeria, is a striking flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow, often with contrasting dark veins. The plant features long, narrow leaves that are covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and ability to attract pollinators.
